description: Vice President Kamala Harris is under increased scrutiny as some Democrats express concerns about President Biden's ability to serve following his debate performance. CBS News campaign reporter Nidia Cavazos asked Harris for her reaction following a fundraiser in San Francisco.
title: Kamala Harris reacts to Trump immunity ruling, Biden debate performance

description: "Look, Joe Biden is our nominee," Vice President Kamala Harris told CBS News exclusively. "We beat Trump once, and we're going to beat him again, period."
title: Harris says "Joe Biden is our nominee" after calls for him to step aside

description: The U.S. Army is searching for ways to keep soldiers cool as they face dangerously high temperatures in the field. CBS News national environmental correspondent David Schechter caught up with the solutions being tested.
title: U.S. Army seeks solution to cool down soldiers facing dangerous heat in the field

description: President Biden spoke out against the Supreme Court's ruling allowing former President Donald Trump some legal immunity over official acts while in the presidency. Donald Trump CBS News senior White House correspondent Weijia Jiang is following Mr. Biden's reaction to the ruling.
title: Biden criticizes Supreme Court ruling on Trump immunity

description: Boeing Starliner commander Barry "Butch" Wilmore and co-pilot Sunita Williams will remain aboard the International Space Station as NASA awaits more technical results before the capsule returns to Earth. CBS News space Analyst Bill Harwood reports.
title: Why NASA is delaying Starliner capsule's return to Earth

description: About half of Americans believe anyone can achieve success in the United States through hard work and determination.
title: Pew study: U.S. divided on whether the American Dream is still possible

description: Marianne Smyth was arrested in Maine and is accused of stealing more than $170,000 from victims in Northern Ireland.
title: Woman accused of posing as heiress in scam is extradited to U.K.

description: White House press secretary Karine Jean-Pierre faced a barrage of questions about President Biden's health and his capacity to serve in the first press briefing since his debate against Donald Trump last week. Jean-Pierre flatly said no when asked if Biden had Alzheimer's or dementia, but said the administration understands the concerns about his health and admitted, "The president did not have a great night at the debate."
title: White House fields questions about Biden's health after poor debate peformance

description: White House press secretary Karine Jean-Pierre shot down a reporter's question asking whether President Biden has Alzheimer's disease or dementia following his lackluster performance during Thursday's debate against former President Donald Trump. Jean-Pierre on Tuesday held the first White House briefing since the debate.
title: White House says Biden doesn't have Alzheimer's

description: Record levels of travel are expected for the Fourth of July weekend across the U.S. AAA predicts around 71 million Americans are traveling 50 miles or more from their home for Independence Day. CBS News Los Angeles' Rick Montanez reports.
title: Travel delays ahead of holiday weekend

description: Transgender middle-distance runner Nikki Hiltz qualified for the Paris Olympics after winning the women's 1,500-meter final at the U.S. Olympic trials on Sunday.
title: Nikki Hiltz, transgender runner, qualifies for U.S. Olympic team

description: Protesters continued to clash with police in Nairobi, Kenya, as demonstrations that started over a controversial finance bill morphed into calls for President William Ruto to resign and anger over police brutality. CBS News foreign correspondent Debora Patta reports.
title: Protesters clash with police in Kenya, call for president's resignation

description: Judge Juan Merchan has delayed the sentencing in Donald Trump's New York criminal case until September after the former president's lawyers argued his conviction should be overturned based on the Supreme Court's ruling on presidential immunity. CBS News investigative reporter Graham Kates has more.
title: Trump's sentencing in New York "hush money" case postponed

description: Sen. Bob Menendez's sister, Caridad Gonzalez, testified on behalf of the defense in the bribery trial against the Democrat from New Jersey. CBS News congressional correspondent Nikole Killion has more.
title: Menendez defense begins case at bribery trial

description: President Biden spoke Tuesday from the Emergency Operations Center in Washington, D.C., where he received a briefing on the extreme weather forecasted across the U.S. Mr. Biden announced new actions to address heat and other weather-related hazards, including federal workplace safety standards.
title: Biden promises extreme weather policy changes

description: Rep. Lloyd Doggett of Texas has become the first Democratic lawmaker to call for President Biden to withdraw from the 2024 presidential race against former President Donald Trump. CBS News congressional correspondent Scott MacFarlane is following the reactions to Mr. Biden's debate performance.
title: Lloyd Doggett becomes first Democrat in Congress to call for Biden to withdraw from 2024 race

description: Hurricane Beryl is churning toward Jamaica after the Category 5 storm slammed Grenada on Monday and reached 160 mph by Tuesday. The deadly storm caused widespread damage to structures, according to reports. Meteorologists Jessica Burch and KC Sherman have the latest forecast, and CBS News correspondent Tom Hanson reports on storm preparations in Montego Bay.
title: Hurricane Beryl destroys homes in Grenada as Jamaica braces for impact

description: Federal regulators say Tempur Sealy's acquisition of Mattress Firm would raise prices for "millions of consumers."
title: FTC blocks Tempur Sealy's $4 billion purchase of Mattress Firm

description: Are you in need of debt relief but don't want to sign up for a service? Here are alternatives to consider.
title: 4 alternatives to a debt relief service to know

description: Mason Branstrator has always been an athlete, but three years ago, he was paralyzed in a skiing accident. It hasn't stopped him from playing sports.
title: After being paralyzed, this 20-year-old competed in a marathon

description: Budget carrier Spirit is eliminating some fees amid growing pushback against hidden airline industry charges.
title: Ailing Spirit Airlines drops some junk fees in hopes of luring travelers

description: Taiwan dispatched two vessels to rescue the fishing boat, which had six people aboard, but they were blocked by the Chinese coast guard, officials said.
title: Taiwan demands release of fishing vessel it says was seized by China

description: Justice Juan Merchan set a new sentencing date of Sept. 18, "if such is still necessary."
title: Trump sentencing delayed as judge weighs Supreme Court immunity ruling

description: Rudy Giuliani disbarred in New York after court finds he lied about Trump’s 2020 election loss; Parts of California under red flag warning amid wildfire threat
title: 7/2: CBS News 24/7 Episode 2

description: Don't miss these 4th of July deals on carry-ons, duffel bags, backpacks and more luggage at Tumi.
title: Tumi luggage sale: Save up to 40% ahead of 4th of July

description: Mason Branstrator's life changed when he was paralyzed at 17. But that hasn't stopped him from playing sports and competing in a marathon. Mason, 20, just completed the wheelchair race at Grandma's Marathon in Duluth, Minnesota.
title: After being paralyzed skiing, this 20-year-old competed in his first marathon

description: Health officials have issued an alert in the Florida Keys after two people were confirmed to have dengue fever.
title: Dengue fever alert issued in Florida Keys after confirmed cases

description: Making these gold investing mistakes could mean you pay more for your 1-ounce gold bars than you bargained for.
title: Investing in 1-ounce gold bars this July? 4 costly mistakes to avoid

description: New research is comparing the weight changes of patients taking different types of popular antidepressants.
title: Patients on these antidepressants were more likely to gain weight, study says

description: There are multiple ways seniors can improve their income this month. Here are five to consider now.
title: 5 ways seniors can boost their income this July

description: British neonatal nurse Lucy Letby is already serving a life sentence after being convicted of murdering seven babies and attempting to kill others.
title: U.K. nurse convicted of killing 7 babies found guilty of another attempted murder

description: Gas prices are even lower in some states, like Washington. Here are ways for drivers to save on gas.
title: July 4th gas prices expected to hit lowest level in 3 years

description: Rudy Giuliani, former President Donald Trump's personal attorney, was disbarred in New York Tuesday for false statements he made about the integrity of the 2020 presidential election. CBS News Justice Department reporter Rob Legare has more.
title: Rudy Giuliani disbarred in New York over 2020 election falsehoods

description: Nike on Friday saw its stock prices plummet 20% after the company warned its current quarter sales would see a steep decline. Hope King, a senior business reporter for Axios, joined CBS News to discuss what has led to the falloff for the shoemaker.
title: Nike stock sees worst day on record, prompting CEO criticism

description: FDA approval of the new Alzheimer's treatment, which will be branded as Kisunla, follows years of setbacks.
title: FDA approves new Alzheimer's treatment from Eli Lilly

description: These monitors are perfect for on-the-go work or play.
title: Best deals on portable monitors ahead of Prime Day 2024

description: Sam's Club is offering yearly memberships for $20. Sign up now to save on groceries in the new year.
title: Sam's Club 4th of July deal: Save 60% on a new membership

description: The military assistance package would be one of the largest of its kind Biden has committed to Ukraine since Russia invaded the country in early 2022.
title: U.S. to announce $2.3 billion in military assistance for Ukraine

description: Hit the road with confidence this summer thanks to the best tire deals ahead of the 4th of July.
title: Best tire deals to shop this 4th of July

description: U.S. military bases in Europe have raised their terror alert to its second-highest level, "FPCON Charlie" over concerns of a possible attack in the coming weeks. CBS News correspondent Lilia Luciano has more.
title: U.S. military bases in Europe on heightened alert. Here's what to know.

description: Following a CBS News investigation into police departments selling or trading in service weapons that were later used in crimes, the department profiled is changing its policy.
title: Police department to stop selling used guns following CBS News investigation

description: The first Democratic lawmakers called on President Biden to drop out of the race after a disastrous debate performance last week prompted emerging concerns among elected Democrats.
title: First Democratic lawmaker calls on Biden to drop out after debate

description: Are you thinking about depositing $10,000 into a 3-year CD? Here's what experts think about doing so.
title: Should you put $10,000 in a 3-year CD this July? Here's what experts think.

description: A new report from Wells Fargo shows homemade burgers are three times cheaper than dining out. Courtney Schmidt, sector manager for Wells Fargo's Agri-Food Institute, joined CBS News to discuss current food costs and how to save money when putting on an Independence Day barbecue.
title: Calculating the cost of July 4th cookouts

description: The U.S. military has raised the security protection measures it is taking at its bases throughout Europe.
title: U.S. military heightens security alert level at European bases

description: More than 5.7 million people are expected to fly somewhere for the Fourth of July, with AAA predicting this week will be the travel week of all time. CBS News Los Angeles reporter Rick Montanez has more.
title: AAA predicts busiest July 4 travel week ever

description: Tech industry group that includes Google and Meta, sued Mississippi, arguing law would unconstitutionally limit access to online speech for minors, adults.
title: Federal judge blocks Mississippi law requiring age verification for websites

description: Want to settle your credit card debt for less than what you owe? Here's how you may be able to do that.
title: 4 best ways to qualify for credit card debt forgiveness

description: One car dealer in New Jersey said he has no choice but to remain patient until systems are fully restored.
title: Car dealerships still struggling 2 weeks after CDK cyberattack

description: Hurricane Beryl intensifies to Category 5 storm; U.S. to pay Moderna $176M to develop bird flu pandemic vaccine as cases in dairy cows rise.
title: 7/2: CBS News 24/7 Episode 1

description: "The Union Island airport's roof is gone. It's no more," the prime minister of St. Vincent and the Grenadines said of the "immense destruction" left by Hurricane Beryl.
title: Hurricane Beryl damages or destroys 90% of homes on one island, leader says

description: President Biden's campaign has pointed to polling following his poor debate performance that still shows support for the president head-to-head against Donald Trump, but as CBS News political correspondent Caitlin Huey-Burns reports, there are underlying concerns about Biden that are coming to the forefront.
title: Polling shows concerns about Biden among Democrats, despite support against Trump

description: Hurricane Beryl has left "immense destruction" in Saint Vincent and the Grenadines, Prime Minister Ralph Gonsalves said, after the storm reportedly severely damaged or destroyed 90% of homes on Union Island. Even the airport's roof "is gone," he said, as the country faces an islandwide blackout and communities have been left without water.
title: Hurricane Beryl damages, destroys 90% of homes on island in Saint Vincent and the Grenadines

description: President Biden plans to meet with Democratic governors in person and virtually to shore up support, CBS News has learned.
title: Biden to meet with Democratic governors as White House works to shore up support

description: CBS News' Seyed Bathaei explains Iranian voters' options and motivations as 2 presidential candidates head for a decisive run-off election round.
title: An insider's look at Iran's presidential election

description: CBS News producer Seyed Bathaei speaks with correspondent Elizabeth Palmer about the two candidates heading for a final, run-off round in Iran's presidential election, and what either of them could mean for the country and its relations with the rest of the world.
title: An insider's look at Iran's presidential election

description: A New York court said in a decision that Rudy Giuliani is disbarred effective immediately.
title: Rudy Giuliani disbarred in New York for falsehoods about 2020 election

description: Two Japanese airlines have laid out behaviors that constitute harassment and could prevent customers from flying.
title: Japanese airlines outline what can get you kicked off a plane

description: An Israeli strike has killed at least nine people in the southern Gaza city of Khan Younis, Palestinian health officials said.
title: 9 killed in strike in Gaza's Khan Younis hours after evacuation order

description: Paul Castle, a blind author and illustrator, and his guide dog, Mr. Maple, were recently denied entry to a Seattle restaurant.
title: Blind artist who was told "you don't look blind" has a mission to educate

description: The Supreme Court's landmark decision giving presidents immunity from criminal prosecution for official acts in office will impact more than just the prosecutions against former President Donald Trump. CBS News legal contributor Rebecca Roiphe goes inside the ruling and CBS News chief White House correspondent Nancy Cordes has more on how President Biden is responding to it.
title: The wide-ranging implications of Supreme Court's immunity ruling for Trump

description: Manhattan prosecutors said they are not opposed to delaying Donald Trump's sentencing​ after the Supreme Court ruled​ that former presidents enjoy immunity for official acts.
title: Manhattan D.A. doesn't oppose Trump sentencing delay after Supreme Court ruling

description: Beryl was upgraded to a Category 5 storm overnight Tuesday, becoming the strongest Atlantic hurricane ever recorded this early in a season. CBS News correspondent Tom Hanson has a report from Jamaica as residents there prepare for Beryl's wrath and CBS News Philadelphia meteorologist Andrew Kozak has a check of the forecast.
title: Hurricane Beryl now a Category 5 storm, strongest Atlantic storm recorded this early in season

description: The newly-released transcripts from 2006 reveal prosecutors knew about accusations against Jeffrey Epstein years before they cut a deal with the late financier.
title: New grand jury transcripts in Epstein case show prosecutors knew accusations

description: The two 19-year-olds each allegedly had loaded weapons and were using a spotlight to hunt when they were arrested.
title: Men arrested for alleged illegal hunting near Oprah's Hawaii home

description: Prosecutors say they will re-try Karen Read after a judge declared a mistrial due to a deadlocked jury in her murder case Monday. Read is accused of hitting her boyfriend, Boston police officer John O'Keefe, with her SUV and leaving him to die in 2022. She says she's being framed for the killing. CBS News Boston reporter Penny Kmitt has more.
title: Prosecutors to re-try Karen Read after mistrial

description: The Dish: Recipe" series presents an easy and refreshing summer cocktail by J.M. Hirsch, editorial director of Christopher Kimball's Milk Street multimedia group and author of the new book "Freezer Door Cocktails." The ingredients you need for this recipe are coconut rum, white rum, a lime, coconut water, and just a little bit of salt.
title: The Dish Recipe: Coconut pie cocktail

description: Save big this 4th of July with refrigerator deals you won't want to miss.
title: Best 4th of July refrigerator deals: Save more than 50%

description: If a rate cut happens later this year, it could have a big impact on mortgage prices. Here's why.
title: How a 2024 Fed rate cut will affect mortgages, according to experts

description: Long-term CDs are a compelling way to lock in today's strong returns for years. Here are some of the best options.
title: 9 best long-term CDs for July 2024 (up to 4.80% APY)

description: Palestinians are being told by Israel's military to leave the eastern part of Gaza's second-largest city, Khan Younis, indicating there could be a new ground operation in the already mostly-destroyed area. CBS News senior foreign correspondent Holly Williams has the latest on the war.
title: Israel orders evacuation of Gaza's 2nd largest city, stoking fears of new ground offensive

description: Measure would protect an estimated 36 million and represent first major federal safety standard of its kind.
title: White House proposes rule to protect workers from extreme heat

description: Upgrade your outdoor living space with new patio furniture that's on sale from Wayfair, Walmart and Amazon.

description: The CDC says it is too early to say if this year's summer COVID-19 surge has arrived.
title: COVID trend reaches "high" levels across western U.S.

description: Indian officials have confirmed scores of deaths after a crowd attending a Hindu religious event reportedly started running to leave at the end, leading to a crush.
title: Stampede at religious gathering in India leaves more than 77 people dead

description: President Biden bashed the Supreme Court's ruling Monday that gives presidents immunity from criminal prosecution for official acts in office, saying "There are no kings in America." The remarks came as his campaign continues its recovery efforts from last week's disastrous debate performance. CBS News chief White House correspondent Nancy Cordes has more on that and the White House's response to Hurricane Beryl.
title: Biden trashes Supreme Court immunity decision, campaign still picking up pieces from debate

description: Thinking of tapping into your home equity this month? Then avoid making these simple yet timely mistakes.
title: 4 home equity mistakes to avoid this July

description: Section 230 of the Communications Decency Act immunizes internet companies from civil liability stemming from content posted to their sites by third parties.
title: Supreme Court declines to review scope of liability shield for internet platforms

description: On this edition of CBS Mornings Deals,  Elizabeth Werner shows us items that might just become essentials in your everyday life. Visit cbsdeals.com to take advantage of these exclusive deals today. CBS earns commissions on purchases made through cbsdeals.com.
title: Exclusive discounts from CBS Mornings Deals

description: The Supreme Court declined to consider the constitutionality of an Illinois law banning certain semi-automatic rifles.
title: Supreme Court won't review Illinois assault weapons ban, leaving it in place

description: Wondering whether the price of gold could grow more this year? Here's what the experts say could happen.
title: Have gold prices peaked for 2024? Here's what experts say

description: The Supreme Court ordered lower courts to take another look at challenges to several federal and state firearms restrictions.
title: Supreme Court kicks gun cases back to lower courts after major ruling

description: Beyond his comeback in "Beverly Hills Cop: Axel F," Eddie Murphy gets candid with "CBS Mornings" co-host Gayle King about fatherhood, his passion for music and  what a return to the stage could look like
title: Eddie Murphy on becoming Axel Foley again after 40 years

description: American military bases in Europe are on heightened alert amid growing concerns of a possible terrorist attack in the coming weeks, U.S. officials say. Bases in Germany, Italy and potentially other countries have reportedly been affected, but details on any specific terror threat remain unknown. CBS News national security contributor Samantha Vinograd has more.
title: U.S. raises terror alert at military bases in Europe

description: A judge declared a mistrial Monday for Karen Read after the jury could not reach a unanimous verdict. Read was charged with second-degree murder, manslaughter while operating under the influence and fleeing the scene where there has been personal injury and death. Read is accused of killing her Boston police officer boyfriend, John O'Keefe.
title: Mistrial declared as jury fails to reach a verdict in Karen Read's trial

description: Save big on Samsung's Frame smart TV, Bespoke refrigerators, AI-powered washers and dryers and more this 4th of July.
title: The best deals at Samsung's 4th of July sale

description: A judge in Florida released grand jury transcripts related to Jeffrey Epstein's state sex crimes case. The 2006 testimony reveals that the case against Epstein began a year earlier. Two victims were questioned during the proceedings, including one who alleged Epstein molested her when she was 14.
title: Florida judge releases grand jury documents from Epstein case

description: In a landmark decision, the Supreme Court ruled in former President Donald Trump's favor Monday, saying in a 6-3 opinion that presidents have immunity for what they do in office, as long as it's an official act.
title: Supreme Court rules presidents have immunity for official acts in major Trump victory

description: Jill Schlesinger joins "CBS Mornings" for a mid-year money check-up to discuss how to save money between now and Labor Day.
title: How to stretch your dollars between now and Labor Day

description: The man's death comes amid warnings of high heat in the area and is the second death recorded in the Grand Canyon this summer.
title: Texas man dies after collapsing during Grand Canyon hike

description: Hurricane Beryl caused devastating damage in the eastern Caribbean Monday. It made landfall as a Category 4 in Grenada. The massive storm later intensified to Category 5 status Monday night, the National Hurricane Center said.
title: Hurricane Beryl lashes Caribbean as a powerful Category 5 storm

description: More than half of U.S. car dealerships are still struggling with a cyberattack that crippled a key software system, hampering their ability to sell cars. J.D. Power estimates the attack may have caused June retail sales to drop more than 5% compared to last year.
title: Car dealerships still struggling with impact of cyberattack

description: Spirit Airlines, known for its pay for everything approach to travel, just dropped its flight change and cancel fees. The low-cost carrier also increased the weight for checked bags to the industry standard of 50 pounds as it looks to win back flyers.
title: Low-cost airline carrier looks to win customers by dropping some hidden junk fees

description: CBS News legal analyst Rikki Klieman and chief political analyst John Dickerson break down the Supreme Court decision in former President Donald Trump's immunity case and what implications it could have.
title: Analysis of Supreme Court's decision on Trump immunity case

description: Wimbledon is underway, and while millions will watch the tennis tournament from the comfort of home, it takes a bit more dedication to get courtside.
title: Meet the diehard tennis fans camped out in Wimbledon's epic "queue"

description: The Supreme Court decides presidents are immune to criminal prosecution for official acts. Also, devastation sweeps across the Caribbean as Hurricane Beryl strengthens to a Category 5. All that and all that matters in today's Eye Opener.
title: Eye Opener: The Supreme Court says presidents have immunity for official acts

description: Actor and comedian Eddie Murphy discusses his journey back to the stage and the revival of his famous character.
title: Eddie Murphy on reviving Axel Foley, fatherhood

description: A CBS News investigation has led several police departments to stop selling used service weapons. This change is viewed as a crucial step in preventing these firearms from being linked to criminal activities. National investigative correspondent Stephen Stock reports.
title: Police agencies change gun sale policies after CBS News investigation

description: Tennis fans around the world are tuning in to watch Wimbledon, but what you don't get to see on-screen is the herculean effort thousands of fans put in to try to be there in person. CBS News' Leah Mishkin meets some of the dedicated queue campers in London.
title: Tennis fans join the epic "Wimbledon queue"

description: Lawyers involved with Jan. 6 prosecutions are focused on the date when the window to bring charges against defendants will close.
title: Attorneys face deadline to wrap Jan. 6 prosecutions. It could slide if Trump wins

description: It's a welcome number for the candidate, who caused widespread concern among Democrats after his debate performance
title: Seeking to calm donors, Biden campaign says it raised $127 million in June

description: A Florida woman with no training in mental health services pretended to be a licensed social worker during online therapy sessions with Brightside Health patients.
title: Fake therapist fooled hundreds online until she died, state records say

description: Presidents have immunity for official acts in office, Supreme Court rules; Michael J. Fox makes surprise appearance at Coldplay performance
title: 7/1: CBS Evening News

description: Under the agreement, U.S. immigration officials will train and provide assistance to Panamanian authorities to help them carry out more deportations of migrants heading north.
title: U.S. agrees to help Panama deport migrants crossing Darién Gap

description: A months-long investigation into hundreds of hoax calls ended in the arrest of a Texas juvenile.
title: Texas Juvenile arrested, accused of more than 100 bomb threats in several states

description: Massachusetts State Police announced that Michael Proctor was "relieved of duty" and transferred out of Norfolk County District Attorney's Office State Police Detective's Unit.
title: Mass. State Trooper Michael Proctor "relieved of duty," transferred out of Norfolk

description: John Dickerson reports on the Supreme Court ruling on Donald Trump's presidential immunity claim, the latest on Hurricane Beryl as it slams parts of the Caribbean as a Category 4 storm, and why illegal crossings at the southern border dropped to a three-year low last month.
title: 7/1: The Daily Report with John Dickerson

description: Former President Trump is trying to overturn his recent felony conviction in the New York "hush money" criminal case.
title: Trump seeks to overturn criminal conviction, citing Supreme Court decision

description: A new law took effect Monday in Tennessee that requires GPS monitoring of the most violent domestic offenders.
title: Tennessee law requires GPS tracking of violent domestic abusers

description: Authorities in San Francisco may have killed a coyote that bit a 5-year-old girl at the San Francisco Botanical Garden last week.
title: Wildlife officials may have killed coyote that bit girl at SF Botanical Garden

description: A new law took effect Monday in Tennessee that requires GPS monitoring of the most violent domestic offenders. Born from an unspeakable tragedy, the law is the first of its kind in the U.S. Meg Oliver reports.
title: Tennessee law mandates GPS tracking for violent domestic abusers

description: CBS Miami chief meteorologist Ivan Cabrera has the latest track on Hurricane Beryl and a look at the extreme heat in the forecast for July Fourth.
title: Tracking Hurricane Beryl and July Fourth heat

description: President Biden is weighing in on the Supreme Court's presidential immunity ruling in remarks from the White House. It comes as Biden's campaign rejects calls to step aside following his disastrous debate performance against former President Donald Trump. Weijia Jiang is at the White House, where the president spoke a short time ago.
title: Biden responds to Supreme Court ruling on Trump immunity

description: American car dealers could lose nearly $1 billion due to an ongoing cyberattack on software provider CDK Global. Charles Carmakal, chief technology officer of Mandiant Consulting, the security consulting organization of Google Cloud, joins CBS News to discuss how the hack is crippling operations, and what can be done to prevent similar incidents from happening again.
title: CDK Global cyberattack still crippling car dealers

description: Israeli officials are criticizing the decision to release the director of Gaza's main hospital. That doctor was held in Israeli custody for seven months without being charged. CBS News foreign correspondent Imtiaz Tyab reports.
title: Israel releases chief of Gaza's Al-Shifa hospital

description: In early June, French President Emmanuel Macron called for surprise parliamentary elections in France as a direct response to the success of right-wing candidates in the European Parliament election. Macron hoped French voters would reject the far-right, but so far that hope has backfired. Max Bergmann, director of the Europe, Russia, and Eurasia program at the Center for Strategic and International Studies, joins CBS News to discuss what the first round of French elections says about the direction of the country, and the future of President Macron.
title: Why is the far-right gaining momentum in France?

description: Illegal crossings at the U.S.-Mexico border fell to a three-year low in June, the lowest level under the Biden administration, according to preliminary Customs and Border Protection data obtained by CBS News. Immigration and politics reporter Camilo Montoya-Galvez has the details.
title: Illegal border crossings drop to lowest monthly number since Biden took office

description: The Biden family says the president is committed to continuing as the Democratic nominee despite concern from lawmakers after his first debate and calls from constituents and editorial boards for him to leave the race. CBS News chief election and campaign correspondent Robert Costa joins with analysis.
title: Some voters question Biden's mental fitness after debate

description: President Biden spoke at the White House on Monday night after the Supreme Court ruled Donald Trump is immune from criminal prosecution for official acts he took as president. Biden called it a dangerous ruling and said the power of the law no longer constrains the power of the office. Weijia Jiang, Scott MacFarlane and David Becker join with analysis.
title: Biden blasts Supreme Court ruling on Trump immunity

description: Hurricane Beryl made landfall Monday on Grenada's Carriacou Island in the Caribbean. The system quickly developed from a tropical depression to a powerful Category 4 storm over the weekend, something experts say is rare this early in the season. CBS News' Tom Hanson has more.
title: Hurricane Beryl marks rare start to season
